comment.author: 31042740@N00
comment._content: Is this Frederick William Victor Augustus Ernest (German: Friedrich Wilhelm Victor August Ernst) (6 May 1882 – 20 July 1951) of the House of Hohenzollern who was the last Crown Prince of the Kingdom of Prussia and the German Empire?

comment.author: 32573662@N00
comment._content: It certainly looks like Wilhelm, and near as I can tell he was the only Crown Prince around that time (his brothers just being Princes). But 1910-15 seems a bit late considering lack of moustache and military uniform. Wilhelm was born in 1882 and so would've been 28-33 at that time, with his eldest son (also Wilhelm) already 4 to 9 years old. I suspect this is more what he would've looked like circa 1910. Not at all scientific, but to me this looks more like a 20-year-old lad, circa 1900 or 1905.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content:
Bain used a lot of older stock photos for their coverage of royalty, see for instance...
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6522026027/]

comment.author: 10248165@N00
comment._content: He looks related to Prince Charles of UK.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @Severinus: It certainly looks as though you are right about the date. One of the pictures of him at www.erstes-garderegiment.de/Bilder/Bild%20332.htm shows him at a very similar age and describes him as an 18-year-old officer. That would have been around 1900.
